[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/connected_component/config.rs] [Trait Implementation: PrePartitionerConfig] [Interface Contract] If the trait contract expects build() to validate the config before creating the partitioner, but this implementation skips validation, could invalid configurations propagate to the execution engine and cause failures? [File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/connected_component/config.rs] [Config-Runtime Interaction] [Integer Conversion Overflow] The group_size_limit is calculated as a usize from f32 arithmetic - if the calculation produces a value larger than usize::MAX, will the 'as usize' cast silently overflow, creating a tiny group_size_limit that defeats the purpose of load balancing? [File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/connected_component/config.rs] [Config-Runtime Interaction] [Division by Zero] If num_shards is set to 0 in the execution context, will the division in group_size_limit calculation panic, and could an attacker trigger this by manipulating shard configuration during reconfiguration? [File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/connected_component/config.rs] [Config-Runtime Interaction] [Negative Block Size] If block_size could somehow be negative (due to bugs elsewhere), would the multiplication with load_imbalance_tolerance produce undefined results that corrupt the partitioning logic? [File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/connected_component/config.rs] [Config-Runtime Interaction] [Edge Case: Empty Block] When block_size = 0, does group_size_limit = (0 * 2.0 / shards).ceil() = 0 cause the partitioner to fail or create invalid partitions? (Medium)
